lines.text: I'm... I remember. John
John, yeah.
And Jane. Your wife is called Jane.
Jane Barrett, yes.
Please do forgive me. I'm so sorry. I just...
It's not a problem, it's okay. It's something I've become accustomed to.
What is?
Having to remind people who I am.

[to Mark Driscoll]
You know my Jane would have loved to come here tonight. She was always talking about you. Always talking about you. I suppose she fell a little bit in love.
Wasn't that sweet. Did she, Mark?
Sally, you find my behavior perfectly normal, do you?
Given the circumstances, yes.
What of my wife's accident? You don't know the circumstances! There's something the three of us will explore together.

[showing her dress to Mark]
Satisfied? Good enough to play the whore?
Tell me about your marriage.
I beg you pardon?
Well, you have a great lifestyle, an interesting job and a beautiful wife. Idyllic, I'd say.
Idyllic, yes...
Idyllic, no!
Tell me about Sally's faults.
Go ahead, tell him. I know what they are, anyway.
Silly things, you know. Nothing important.
Like, I drink too much.
Yeah, now and again.
I wonder why.
Mark knows he attracts women. It can be irritating.
It took a lot planning this meeting.
Meeting? It's fucking kidnap!
You hadn't realized in any way that she might be having an affair?
Do you realize when, or should I say, if?
One prefers to ignore it. So long as it's not actually thrust in your face.
